gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Abstract: This image service displays the latest, high resolution, aerial imagery over various areas of Queensland, acquired under the Spatial Imagery Subscription Plan (SISP). Earth-i/SPOT satellite imagery covers the areas where SISP aerial photography is unavailable. This service, uses a map cache created for the following scales: 1:2257, 1:4514, 1:9028, 1:18,084, 1:36,112, 1:72,224, 1:144,448, 1:288,895, 1:577,791, 1:1,155,581, 1:2,311,162, 1:4,622,324 and 1:9,244,649. Periodical updates will be made to display the most recent imagery as they become available. Please note, the imagery in this service is only licensed for Queensland Government entities (state government agencies, Local Government Authorities, and Government Owned Corporations) and Natural Resource Management Groups, who are current Spatial Imagery Subscription Plan members.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Queensland Imagery Whole Of State Satellite Public Basemap Service

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString:
This basemap service displays a visually-enhanced mosaic of high resolution, authoritative, general reference imagery captured by CubeSat satellite space-crafts (Planet Labs Incorporated) over areas of Queensland. This service is designed to provide a performance imagery basemap (on demand cache) for clients that dont support cached/tiled services.
This 2.4 metre resolution, orthorectified, visual mosaic product was originally acquired by Planet during 2017 Quarter 3, under the QSat initiative. The mosaic is made visually appealing for a wide variety of applications that require imagery with an accurate geolocation and cartographic projection. Optimal for simple and direct use of the imagery.

ArcGIS Keyhole markup Language KML / KMZ link
Open Geospatial Consortium (OGC) Web Map Service

gmd:statement.gco:CharacterString:
The mosaic contains a single-layer composite of multiple customised, PlanetScope ortho tiles (5 km x 5 km) where each tile is composed of the highest quality natural colour (RGB) PlanetScope Ortho Scene product imagery acquired between 1st July 2017 and 30th September 2017 (2017 Quarter 3). Each PlanetScope scene used in the generation of a tile may have been originally captured at a Ground Sample Distance (GSD) of up to 3.7 metres (at reference altitude 475km).
Sensor-related effects are corrected using sensor telemetry and a sensor model, bands are co-registered, and spacecraft-related effects are corrected using attitude telemetry and best available ephemeris data.
The PlanetScope tiles are orthorectified and colour-corrected (using a colour curve). This correction attempts to optimize colours as seen by the human eye providing images as they would look if viewed from the perspective of the satellite. The tiles are processed to remove distortions caused by terrain and can be used for cartographic mapping and visualization purposes. The image processing eliminates the perspective effect on the ground (not on buildings), restoring the geometry of a vertical shot. Additionally, a correction is made to the sun angle in each image to account for differences in latitude and time of acquisition. The PlanetScope tiles are orthorectified using GCPs and fine DEMs (30 m to 90 m posting) to less than 10 m RMSE positional accuracy.
Total cloud cover of the mosaic product is 0.23%.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Department of Natural Resources, Mines and Energy

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Queensland Imagery High Resolution Satellite QG SISP Restricted Time-Series

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: A time-series service that displays various epochs of visually-enhanced mosaics of high resolution authoritative general reference imagery captured by satellite platforms over areas of Queensland. This service is designed to provide access to the full State Remotely Sensed Image Library collection of this data and license type including the latest available satellite imagery over Queensland under the Spatial Imagery Subscription Plan (SISP). Further individual epoch mosaic product metadata information is available from the Queensland Spatial Catalogue (QSpatial).

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Queensland vegetation management web map service

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: This web map service contains mapping data that will assist you to work through the vegetation management framework. It details areas of regulation, and outlines rules and values that must be considered when clearing native vegetation. It also includes mapping layers to assist with determining land suitability for high value agriculture. Due to the complex nature of some data layers, the service display scale ranges from 1:577792 to 1:1.

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: If you incorporate this service or layers from this service in your own application or workflow please let us know so we can advise you of planned changes or downtime for this service.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Department of Natural Resources, Mines and Energy

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: The Queensland location text web service is designed to be used in conjunction with raster data such as remotely-sensed imagery or digital elevation models. It consists almost exclusively of geographic labels. The service is based on data acquired and collated by the Department of Natural Resources, Mines and Energy, Queensland for more than thirty years. Map cache tiles are created for the following scales: 1:282, 1: 564, 1: 1128, 1: 2257, 1: 4514, 1: 9028, 1:18,056, 1:36,112, 1:72,224, 1:144,448, 1:288,895, 1:577,791, 1:1,155,581, 1:2,311,162, 1:4,622,324, 1:9,244,649, 1:18,489,298 and 1:36,978,595. The map cache will be refreshed periodically to show updated data.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Queensland Imagery Earliest Aerial Ortho Public Basemap Service

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString:
A basemap image service that displays a mosaic comprised of the earliest digitised aerial film photography over various locations in Queensland. Copyright for this imagery has expired and is considered part of the public domain. When publishing it is requested to acknowledge the original owner: Commonwealth of Australia(Geoscience Australia). The source, digitally scanned aerial photo frames (unrectified) were produced by the State of Queensland (Department of Natural Resources, Mines and Energy) and are available through QImagery - https://qimagery.information.qld.gov.au
State of Queensland (Department of Natural Resources, Mines and Energy) 2018. Includes material Commonwealth of Australia (Geoscience Australia). There are no use limitation on this service.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Queensland Imagery Cyclone Debbie 2017 Post 3m Public Basemap Service

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: This service displays PlanetScope 3m Satellite Imagery over areas affected by the Tropical Cyclone Debbie in March and April 2017. The imagery is temporarily available to support recovery efforts relating to Cyclone Debbie. Please note that access to imagery is granted under the CC-NC-BY license (data cannot be used for commercial purposes)and can only be used for humanitarian purposes related in response to this event.

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString:
This service displays a complete state-wide digital land use map of Queensland. It is based on the Queensland Land use Mapping Program (QLUMP) data product produced by the Queensland Government. The service presents the most recent mapping of land use features for Queensland.
The service is cached to the standard Google / Bing Maps scale levels from 1:591,657,551 to 1:9,028.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Queensland land parcel property framework web map service

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: This Web Map Service displays land parcel and related property information maintained by the Department of Natural Resources and Mines, Queensland. The service also includes some general locational information to assist the user.The data layers shown include: Land Parcels from the Digital Cadastral Database (DCDB) The "Land Parcels" group layer has sub-layers that show selected land parcels at different scale ranges to aid visualisation and drawing speed. The land parcels are also available in base, easement, strata and volumetric only layers.Addresses from the Queensland Address Management Framework database.Location information including:Populated Places from the Queensland Place Names database.State BorderCoastlineAdministrative Boundaries information including:Local Government Areas, Locality Boundaries.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Queensland imagery (public) image web map service

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: The Queensland Imagery (Public) image service displays Landsat 8 imagery over the whole of Queensland, and high resolution imagery, acquired under the Spatial Imagery Subscription Plan (SISP), prior to the year 2013, over some areas of the state. The high resolution SISP imagery over three years old is made available for general use by the Department of Natural Resources and Mines, Queensland. The service uses a map cache currently created for the following scales: 1:2257, 1:4514, 1:9028, 1:18,084, 1:36,112, 1:72,224, 1:144,448, 1:288,895, 1:577,791, 1:1,155,581, 1:2,311,162, 1:4,622,324 and 1:9,244,649. The map service endpoint also displays dynamically to larger scales than those listed. The map cache will be refreshed periodically to show more recent imagery projects as they become available for public use.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Property Location Service Plus- Public version

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString:
The Property Location Service Plus- Public version (PLSplus-Public) is available to anyone and used to validate Queensland addresses and property descriptions. The service can also supply location data from a geocode. The service does not offer interstate (non Queensland) address validation information. The service is free of charge and requires authentication.
It replaces the PLS-Public address validation service due to be deprecated in early 2017.
To use the PLSplus-Public service an application utilising a file called a "WSDL" (Web Service Description Language) is required. The WSDL is an XML-based language that is used for describing the functionality offered by a web service.The WSDL description provides a machine-readable description of how the service can be called, what parameters it expects, and what data structures it returns. The wsdl is available (with service guidelines) at the online resources link of this record. The wsdl contains the required endpoint for the service. PLSplus-Public now requires authentication to use it but the wsdl can be viewed at https://information.qld.gov.au/service/Addressing/ValidationService/PLSplusPublic/soap?wsdl Instructions to apply for username and password are contained in the Information document found at the online resources link.
PLSplus-Public provides the following operations:- ValidateAddress- ValidateLotPlan- ValidateCoordinates- ParseAddress and AutoCompleteAddress
A successful validation of any of the first four operations (for Queensland locations) will also return other information, such as address, lot on plan, coordinates, address type and a matching confidence level for each request. The AutoCompleteAddress operation can be used to find a correct address or used in conjunction with the two address validation functions above to retrieve other information about the address.
The ValidateAddress operation validates the existence of a requested address. The address elements are in a rigid structure based around Australian Addressing Standards. If an identical address is found it returns all information about the address with a matching confidence. If no exact match is found it returns possible candidate addresses (up to 500) that best match the search criteria. A global confidence is given for all candidates. The requested elements of the address is parsed by the application.The ValidateAddress operation also geocodes the address and returns the geocoded coordinates.- The only field that is mandatory in the request is the street name or property name- Street Name can consist of a "street name" or "street name" and "street type",or "street name" and "street type" and "street suffix".- McCaul- McCaul Street- McCaul Street North
The ValidateLotPlan operation validates the existence of a Queensland "Lot on Plan" description and also returns the addresses and geocodes (if the parcel has them) for valid parcels. The requested Lot on Plan elements must be in a rigid structure to be parsed by the application. It should be noted that not all valid property descriptions have addresses and some parcels may have multiple addresses.
The ValidateCoordinates operation provides a service to validate entered Latitude/Longitude coordinates within Queensland and return the closest addresses for the requested location. Search logic begins with a radius of of up to 250 metres. If no result is found the service locates the parcel or the coordinates and returns all addresses on that parcel. The coordinates elements is a rigid structure to be parsed by the application. Coordinates (in Degree.Decmial format ) with search box limited to - North Latitude: -9.0 West Longitude: 138.0- South Latitude: -29.5 East Longitude:155.0 - Coordinates will always be a negative Latitude and a positive Longitude.
The AutoCompleteAddress operation returns up to 20 valid addresses based on the input of a text string. The longer the string typed the shorter the list of candidate addresses. Any address from returned candidates can be used as input to ParseAddress operation to return further information about the address.
The ParseAddress operation provides a service to parse (into address components) and validate any entered Queensland address and return any associated addresses, lot on plans, geocode and confidence for a requested address in a free form string field.eg. Unit 1 25B Smith Street East Earlsville Qld

srv:operationName.gco:CharacterString: PLSplusPublic

gmd:name.gco:CharacterString: SOAP WebService WSDL and Documentation in ZIP (compressed files)

gmd:explanation.gco:CharacterString: A specific WSDL is available for this service at http://qspatial.information.qld.gov.au/serviceInfo/PLSPlusPublic.zip or the wsdl can be called at https://information.qld.gov.au/service/Addressing/ValidationService/PLSplusPublic/soap?wsdl

gmd:statement.gco:CharacterString: The data source for this service is the Queensland Address Management Framework (QAMF) data set which is maintained by the Department of Natural Resources and Mines (DRNM).The Queensland Address Management Framework (QAMF) has replaced the Property Location Index (PLI) as the primary source of property location addressing information for Queensland. It is location centric, meaning that addresses can be geocoded against a variety of locations, eg centroid of the property and in the future against other locations succh as centroid of the street alignment, entrance of the property, the main building. It is the point of truth for addressing in Queensland. The database is updated each working night.Attributes currently stored include:- Lot Number- Plan Number- Geocode- Unit Number- Street Number- Street Name or Property Name- Street Suffix- Street Type- Locality- StateCurrently Floor/Level or postcode information does not form part of this dataset.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Department of Natural Resources and Mines

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Property Location Service Plus- Queensland Government version

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString:
The Property Location Service Plus- Queensland Government version (PLSplus-QG) is available to all Qld Government agencies and used to validate Australian addresses and Queensland property descriptions. The service can also supply location data from a geocode. The service does offer interstate (non Queensland) address validation information. The service is free of charge and requires authentication.
It replaces the PLS-QG address validation service due to be deprecated on Sept 30th 2017.
To use the PLSplus-QG service an application utilising a file called a "WSDL" (Web Service Description Language) is required. The WSDL is an XML-based language that is used for describing the functionality offered by a web service.The WSDL description provides a machine-readable description of how the service can be called, what parameters it expects, and what data structures it returns. The wsdl is available (with service guidelines) at the online resources link of this record. The wsdl contains the required endpoint for the service. PLSplus-QG requires authentication to use it. Instructions to apply for username and password are contained in the Information document found at the online resources link.
PLSplus-QG provides the following operations:- ValidateAddress- ValidateLotPlan- ValidateCoordinates- ParseAddress and AutoCompleteAddress
A successful validation of any of the address operations (for Australian locations) will also return other information, such as address, lot on plan (Qld only), coordinates, address type and a matching confidence level for each request. Validation of LotPlan and Co-ordinates is only available for Qld locations. The validation returns other information as per the address functions. Further functionality within this services is to return Australian Bureau of Statistics meshblock information for an Australian address address or Queensland property. The AutoCompleteAddress operation can be used to find a correct Queensland address or used in conjunction with the two address validation functions above to retrieve other information about the address.
The ValidateAddress operation validates the existence of a requested Australian address . The address elements are in a rigid structure based around Australian Addressing Standards. If an identical address is found it returns all information about the address with a matching confidence. If no exact match is found it returns possible candidate addresses (up to 500) that best match the search criteria. A global confidence is given for all candidates. The requested elements of the address is parsed by the application.The ValidateAddress operation also geocodes the address and returns the geocoded coordinates.- The only field that is mandatory in the request is the street name or property name- Street Name can consist of a "street name" or "street name" and "street type",or "street name" and "street type" and "street suffix".- McCaul- McCaul Street- McCaul Street North
The ValidateLotPlan operation validates the existence of a Queensland "Lot on Plan" description and also returns the addresses and geocodes (if the parcel has them) for valid parcels. The requested Lot on Plan elements must be in a rigid structure to be parsed by the application. It should be noted that not all valid property descriptions have addresses and some parcels may have multiple addresses.
The ValidateCoordinates operation provides a service to validate entered Latitude/Longitude coordinates within Queensland and return the closest addresses for the requested location. Search logic begins with a radius of of up to 250 metres. If no result is found the service locates the parcel or the coordinates and returns all addresses on that parcel. The coordinates elements is a rigid structure to be parsed by the application. Coordinates (in Degree.Decmial format ) with search box limited to - North Latitude: -9.0 West Longitude: 138.0- South Latitude: -29.5 East Longitude:155.0 - Coordinates will always be a negative Latitude and a positive Longitude.
The AutoCompleteAddress operation returns up to 20 valid Queensland addresses based on the input of a text string. The longer the string typed the shorter the list of candidate addresses. Any address from returned candidates can be used as input to ParseAddress operation to return further information about the address.
The ParseAddress operation provides a service to parse (into address components) and validate any entered Australian address and return any associated addresses, lot on plans (Qld only), geocode and confidence for a requested address in a free form string field.eg. Unit 1 25B Smith Street East Earlsville Qld

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Queensland Imagery Cyclone Debbie 2017 Post 5m Public Basemap Service

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: This service displays RapidEye 5m Satellite Imagery over areas affected by the Tropical Cyclone Debbie in March and April 2017. The imagery is temporarily available to support recovery efforts relating to Cyclone Debbie. Please note that access to imagery is granted under the CC-NC-BY license (data cannot be used for commercial purposes) and can only be used for humanitarian purposes related in response to this event.

gmd:statement.gco:CharacterString: Mapping of mangrove and associated vegetation communities is based on the interpretation of landscape as depicted on aerial photos and ground truthed on a limited sample of known points. The Queensland Herbarium uses the 1:25,000 black and white 1955 aerial photograph as the best available imagery for mapping mangrove and associated vegetation communities. Vegetation boundaries are digitised on computer screen to orthophotos baseline. Field survey provided partial verification of boundaries.
